parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.50

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Strings

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Checks whether given string name is [[localize]]d.
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Since Arma 3 v2.03.147217, [[isLocalized]] accepts prefix <tt>"$"</tt> in the key name</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Wiki </title><part><name index="1"/><value> TODO </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Remove above with 2.04 release, update examples </value></part></template>
</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''isLocalized''' stringName

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> stringName: [[String]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[if]] ([[isLocalized]] "STR_DN_SNAKE") [[then]] {
	[[hint]] [[localize]] "STR_DN_SNAKE";
} [[else]] {
	[[hint]] "STR_DN_SNAKE";
	[[diag_log]] "ToDo: STR_DN_SNAKE is not localized";
};</code>

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[localize]],[[diag_localized]], [[getTextRaw]], [[WFSideText]], [[Stringtable.csv]], [[Stringtable.xml]], [[BIS_fnc_localize]]
</value></part></template></root>
